str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To notify, command, charge, entreat solemnly. From para and the base of aggelos; to transmit a message, i.e. to enjoin.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Unclean, impure. Impure (lewd) or specially, (demonic).
Wind, breath, spirit.
To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
Much, many; often.
A space of time or interval; by extension, an individual opportunity; by implication, delay.

parse: Verb - Pluperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To seize, drag by force. From sun and harpazo; to snatch together, i.e. Seize.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To bind, put in chains, tie together. From a derivative of desmeo; to be a binder, i.e. To enchain, to tie on.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Probably from phule through the idea of isolation; to watch, i.e. Be on guard; by implication, to preserve, obey, avoid.
A (light) chain, bond. Of uncertain derivation; a fetter or manacle.
And, even, also, namely.
A shackle, fetter for the feet. Ultimately from pous; a shackle for the feet.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To tear asunder, burst, rend. From dia and rhegnumi; to tear asunder.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Or desmos des-mos' neuter and masculine respectively from deo; a band, i.e. Ligament or shackle; figuratively, an impediment or disability.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) trans: I drive (on), propel, (b) intrans: I row. A prolonged form of a primary verb of uncertain affinity; to push.
A primary preposition; under, i.e. of place, or with verbs; of place (underneath) or where (below) or time (when).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
An evil-spirit, demon; a heathen deity. Neuter of a derivative of daimon; a d?Monic being; by extension a deity.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Lonesome, i.e. waste.
